intro: Siphonoglossa sulcata, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, zigzagging leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Siphonoglossa sulcata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique foliage structure. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile choice for garden settings.
